unnormalised: **Rental Agreements: Are You Playing it Smart, Yaar?**
normalised: **Rental Agreements: Are You Playing it Smart, Friend?**

unnormalised: Mumbai, Oct 26 - Renting in Aamchi Mumbai or anywhere in India can be a real chakkar, right? Especially when it comes to rental agreements. Nobody wants a "Deewar" situation with their landlord, bhai!
normalised: Mumbai, October twenty-sixth - Renting in Our Mumbai or anywhere in India can be a real hassle, right? Especially when it comes to rental agreements. Nobody wants a "Deewar" situation with their landlord, brother!

unnormalised: New rules are popping up faster than Diwali lights. Did you know some agreements now require Aadhaar linking? Landlords are getting stricter about everything from pets to painting walls.
normalised: New rules are popping up faster than Diwali lights. Did you know some agreements now require A A D H A A R linking? Landlords are getting stricter about everything from pets to painting walls.

unnormalised: Experts at the Indian Institute of Property Law (IIPL) suggest reading the fine print *before* you hand over that security deposit (usually around 2-3 months' rent, folks!).
normalised: Experts at the Indian Institute of Property Law (I I P L) suggest reading the fine print *before* you hand over that security deposit (usually around two to three months' rent, folks!).

unnormalised: Things to watch out for: lock-in periods, yearly rent increases (typically around 5-10%), and who pays for what repairs.
normalised: Things to watch out for: lock-in periods, yearly rent increases (typically around five to ten percent), and who pays for what repairs.

unnormalised: Also, don't forget those pesky stamp duty and registration charges! Can easily be Rs. 5000 - Rs. 10000 depending on the rent and location.
normalised: Also, don't forget those pesky stamp duty and registration charges! Can easily be rupee five thousand - rupee ten thousand depending on the rent and location.

unnormalised: Getting a lawyer to look over the agreement might seem like extra kharcha, but it could save you from a lot of future headaches.
normalised: Getting a lawyer to look over the agreement might seem like extra expense, but it could save you from a lot of future headaches.

unnormalised: So, be a smart renter, folks! Knowledge is power! Happy house hunting!
normalised: So, be a smart renter, folks! Knowledge is power! Happy house hunting!
